title: Weekly Discretionary
event_description: Join the AAS Budgetary Committee (BC) to request funding from the AAS Discretionary Fund for any student activities you wish to put on! Prior to arriving, please review the funding policies and put your name, the club you are representing, and what you are asking for here under the appropriate week. Please forward any questions to budgetary@amherst.edu or reach out to your BC Representatives listed here.
location: Cole Assembly Room (Red Room), Converse Hall

title: Quiz Bowl
event_description: Come for Trivia, Snacks and Friendship!!!

title: Weekly Meeting
event_description: Our weekly AAS meeting where we pass Budgetary reccomendations and discuss issues on campus.

title: AISA (AI Safety @ Amherst) Speaker Event: Eddie Zhang
event_description: Join us on November 5th from 4-5 PM in Science Center E108 to hear OpenAI Resident and Harvard PhD student Eddie Zhang's talk on AI safety! Presenting remotely, Eddie will give an overview of AI Safety research projects at OpenAI and speak about his new non-profit Humanity Unleashed, which aims to develop AI tools to improve the government's ability to predict outcomes of economic and policy interventions.After the talk, there will be an informal mingling session for students across the five Colleges to network and discuss their thoughts on AI safety and governance. Food from Royal Chicken & Kebab will be provided. Interested attendees should RSVP by Friday, Nov 1st. You can either scan the QR code or use this link: https://forms.gle/Z12X2dsqnrnAtHt37

title: Fencing Club Practice
event_description:
The anatomy of a typical fencing club meeting is as follows:

1) Warmup: We might play a quick game involving running, or we may just jog for a minute or two

2) Stretching: Stretching is important before working out!

3) Footwork: Footwork is key to fencing! We practice it each meeting to make sure we've got it down, and play some footwork-based games

4) Bladework: We break out the swords and learn how to use them!

5) Fencing: We set up electric scoring equipment and fence each other with the remaining time

This semester, we are meeting Tuesdays and Thursdays at 4-5:30 in Middleton Gym!

For more information, contact mammothfencing@gmail.com!

title: Regular Theatrical Choreography Club (TCC) Meeting
event_description: Gather one and all to practice your sword (among other weapons) combat against friend and foe alike, SAFELY. To create great spectacles and drama is terrific on its own but what if you added WEAPONS (AND SAFETY). If the likes of the Princess Bride or Pirates of the Caribbean have ever gotten your blood rushing and riled up your instinct to pick up a roughly sword-shaped object, then this is the place for you to indulge those desires, SAFELY. So join us if you dare, but only if you are prepared for a fun (and safe) time...
location: Middleton Gym - Alumni Gym OR Front of Alumni Gym (Weather Depending)

title: Amherst Debate Society Practice
event_description: Amherst Debate Society Practice

title: Queer and Questioning
event_description: Do you have questions about queerness? Are you exploring your identity? Are you in need of a space to discuss anything gender and/or sexuality related with no labels involved? Then stop by our student-led support group at Keefe 203, every Tuesday at 7:30 pm. All sessions are private and do not require regular involvement! No college staff/faculty will be present during the sessions.

title: Keefe Campus Center Election Watch Party
event_description:
Join Student Affairs along with student organizations for a Keefe Campus Center takeover, Election Watch Party. All three floors of Keefe will have interactive experiences to engage in during the election along with food and resources! All programming will run from 7 p.m. - 10 p.m. with the Friedman Room viewing continuing until midnight!
 
What is happening and where? 
6pm-7pm vigil at Memorial Hill
Religious and Spiritual Life - Keefe 017 - RSL chaplains are here to offer pastoral guidance and support to our community.
Jose Marti Room - Speak Spanish? Want to be in community with others who do? Join student leaders from La Causa for a Spanish broadcast from Telemundo or Univisonn. 
Keefe Atrium - Check out our map of the US. States will be colored in as results roll in. Stop by throughout the night to see how things are going. 
Grab n Go - Late Night is popping up in Grab n Go! Stop by from 9p-11p for your regularly scheduled late night snacking! 
Mail Room - Drinks and cookies from Late Night available in the mail room! 
Wellbeing Makerspace - Keefe 101- Drop in the Wellbeing Makerspace to join the Peer Educators for Powering Down from the Polls, a community-arts event. This is a space to take a break and unplug from the election. 
Student Engagement and Leadership- Keefe 102 - Does decompressing involve Mario Kart or maybe Just Dance? Pop into Student Engagement and Leadership for some Switch gaming. 
Friedman Room - MSNBC will be on from 7p-12a, and students from the Amherst College Democrats will be in the space hanging out with you. 
Keefe 203 - Fox News Broadcast 
 
Additional watch parties in Center for International Student Engagement, Multicultural Resource Center, Queer Resource Center, Women and Gender Center, and Class Action Resource Center!
 
 
What is Late Night serving?
- Queso Bravo Dip
- Chicken Bacon Ranch
- Tomato Salsa
- Black Bean and Corn Salsa
- Tortilla Chips
- Cookies
- Canned Beverages 
 
What kind of resources are available? 
Amherst College staff will be around in spaces until 10 p.m. ready to chat about the elections and how you are feeling. Garett Fitzgerald from the Center for Counseling and Mental Health (CCMH) and the Wellness Team will be available in the Powerhouse from 6:30-10 p.m. for a quiet space to talk more. 
 
What can I do while I wait for election night? 
Be sure to check out TurboVotes and make sure you are registered to vote and know how to vote! If you want to participate in a contest, check out our 270 to Win contest and enter to win! 
 
Who do I contact if I want to help out, have a question or need to request an accommodation? 
Please reach out to SEL@amherst.edu and Student Engagement and Leadership staff will connect with you.

title: First Gen Wednesdays Get Together!!
event_description: Start the day strong! The First Gen CRG will be providing apple cider & apple themed snacks – staff, faculty and students alike are welcomed!

title: Destress or Distract with QRC & CARC!
event_description:
Need some time to destress or distract after Election Day? You can pick between two spaces: 1) you can crochet cute animals at CARC, which will be a quieter, crafty mindful space! or 2) you can play card and board games with friends at the QRC for a more fun, lively time! 

No experience required! Pizza and boba will be provided ~

title: Popcorn Pop-in
event_description: Pop in to Student Engagement and Leadership every Wednesday for popcorn and conversation! A special topping every week, good company, and a time to ask questions about your organizations. We can't wait to see you!

title: Proofing Party!
event_description:
Join us for a fun and collaborative Proofing Party! This event is perfect for anyone who enjoys working with words, refining content, or just wants to lend a keen eye to important documents. We’ll be gathering to review and polish The Indicator, ensuring it’s clear, engaging, and error-free.

Bring your editing skills, attention to detail, and a good sense of humor as we work together to make this publication shine. Dinner (from Formosa!) will be provided to keep the energy going. Whether you’re a grammar guru, a spelling savant, or just want to help out, we welcome you to be part of this collective effort!

title: APU Election Debrief — Pizza and Politics
event_description: Join APU to discuss and digest the election results with pizza! This event is a chance to unwind, connect with your peers, and more deeply understand the political landscape following the election. All perspectives are welcome.

title: "Cultivating" Health - Stories of Filipino Farmworkers
event_description:
Public Health Collaborative is partnering with LUNAS Global Health Network to discuss how climate change has disproportionately affected the Philippines and their farmers. Formosa catering will be provided. 

 

This event will be held 7:30-8:30 in the science center, in Lipton lecture hall - E 110.

title: Food Justice Alliance Weekly Meeting
event_description: Come join the Food Justice Alliance for our weekly meeting! At our general meetings, we might discuss food justice issues, plan key events like collaborations with the Book & Plow Farm, cook or bake together, coordinate the Food Recovery Program @ Val or other volunteer opportunities, and much more. Come join us in Chapin 204 at 8pm every week!

title: Hub Happy Hour
event_description: Have questions about using the Hub? Maybe about planning an event, leading your RSO, recruiting or more? Stop into Keefe 102 on Thursdays from 3:30-4:30 pm to talk with Director of Student Engagement and Leadership about your group over a Polar Seltzer.

title: QTPOC Weekly Meeting
host: Queer and Trans People of Color Collective
event_description: Every Thursday at 5:30pm in the Queer Resource Center, located on the 2nd floor of Keefe Campus Center, QTPOC (Queer Trans People of Color Collective) host weekly discussions and activities for queer students of color! We will always have snacks, games, and fun activities to help you get away from the noise of the campus!
location: Queer Resource Center 2nd Floor of Keefe

title: Poetry Parlor
event_description: The Poetry Club is profoundly proud to present the Prose and Poetry Parlor! Come share and talk about your writing — of any form or style — in an open, supportive, and informal space. We will host open mics, workshop-style discussions, low-stakes writing challenges — the sky's the limit! With these biweekly gatherings, we hope to provide an environment that encourages and connects the writing community on campus. Come visit us at Pemberton Lounge!

title: Amherst Cricket Club Practices
event_description:
Dear Cricketers,
 
This semester's practices are scheduled on the following times at a weekly cadence in Coolidge Cage (Alumni Gym aka Tennis Courts):
  • Thursday 8-10 pm
  • Saturday 3-5 pm
So, the INTRO-meeting is (12th Sept) THIS THURSDAY 8-10 pm!!! Equipment & Snacks/Drinks Covered!
 
Before that, as per the Amherst College rules, please fill out the waiver below so that we can start the ball rolling! And, I have also sent all of you invites on the Hub to join the club, so please accept the invite there to stay posted! (GroupMe: https://groupme.com/join_group/97352198/c7Az2Nim)

How do I sign the waiver?

Link: https://risk-management.mtholyoke.edu/waivers/login.php

Once logged in, you should click on Waiver Form in the top left-hand corner, and then select the following from the drop-down menus:

College: Amherst College
Activity Type: Student Group
Activity Name: Amherst College Cricket Club

After that you will be prompted to sign and fill in your background information!

Thank you so much for your support and patience throughout this!

Take care,

Founder & President of Cricket Club

title: Study Away 101
event_description: Are you considering studying away for a semester (or two!)? We'll be covering the basics of the process for both international and domestic programs, including what programs are available, financial considerations, when to start applications, and more. Students are expected to attend this info session before making an appointment with a GEO advisor.

title: FLI Freshmen and Faculty Lunch with Dean Vigil
event_description: Craving food from Formosa and Ginger Garden? First Generation and Low Income first-years are all invited to this casual lunch with Dean Vigil. HOWEVER, there is a fun twist! You can invite your favorite professors from this semester and enjoy a meal with them. This is an opportunity to get to know your professor, ask questions about office hours, and build connections. Don't miss out - RSVP with this link!

title: Paths of Possibilities: Alumni Panel
event_description:
Are you curious about graduate school or working in industry as a Math or Stats major? We cordially invite interested students, staff, and faculty to join our Alumni Panel Discussion. In Petkova (c/o '06), Michelle Ngo (c/o '15), and Tara Yoo (c/o '15) will be sharing their insights about graduate students and career paths. Food from El Comalito will be served! Hosted by the MS-DEI Fellows, CARC, CISE, SEL, and ISA! 

 

RSVP HERE!!!

title: Diwali Celebration
event_description: Join the South Asian Student Association for our annual Diwali celebration. There will be lots of free and delicious Indian food in addition to live student performances. We will also have a henna station where some students will be making henna designs for others, or you can try your own hand at henna. We will also be creating rangoli with marigolds and would love for you to contribute to our communal rangoli creation. Come by and stay as long or as little as you'd like to support your fellow students, learn more, and celebrate with us!

title: Cookstove Project - Saving Women and Childrens' Health in Uganda and Nepal
event_description:
Cookstove project aims to eliminate the preventable deaths in developing countries that are caused by cooking with a three stone open fire. Nearly 2.3 billion people, about 1/3 the world's population prepare food for their families using an open fire in their home.  This inefficient cooking method exposes users to dangerous pollutants.
They train and supervise families in the process of building and maintaining their own clean cookstoves. In order to keep costs low and to ensure the organic growth of the project, they mostly use local materials that are readily accessible to homeowners. Each stove is custom made to accommodate the cooking pots used in the home. The project emphasizes personal and community ownership, which ensures that the stoves will continue to be used for years to come.  

Amherst College Public Health Collaborative will be holding a conversation about how this project marries sustainability and health, and also how cooking affects womens' and childrens' health in developing countries.

title: Building Green: Sustainable and Socially Just Architecture
event_description:
Join EJA for a panel and dinner about sustainable architecture! We will be speaking with Professor Dwight Carey (Amherst College), Professor Naomi Darling (Mount Holyoke College), and Professor Robert Ryan (UMass). Attendees will learn about our speakers' backgrounds in career paths, the importance of sustainable design, and how architecture and urban planning can reinforce (or contradict) social justice principles. Dinner will be provided!

 

Hosted with support from SEL and the Amherst College Architectural Studies Program.

We'll be covering the basics of the process for both international and domestic programs, including what programs are available, financial considerations, when to start applications, and more. Students are expected to attend this info session before making an appointment with a GEO advisor.

title: General Meeting
event_description: Come sign out a camera and learn about film photography!

title: QTPOC Weekly Meeting
host: Queer and Trans People of Color Collective
event_description: Every Thursday at 5:30pm in the Queer Resource Center, located on the 2nd floor of Keefe Campus Center, QTPOC (Queer Trans People of Color Collective) host weekly discussions and activities for queer students of color! We will always have snacks, games, and fun activities to help you get away from the noise of the campus!
location: Queer Resource Center 2nd Floor of Keefe

title: Amherst Cricket Club Practices
event_description:
Dear Cricketers,
 
This semester's practices are scheduled on the following times at a weekly cadence in Coolidge Cage (Alumni Gym aka Tennis Courts):
  • Thursday 8-10 pm
  • Saturday 3-5 pm
So, the INTRO-meeting is (12th Sept) THIS THURSDAY 8-10 pm!!! Equipment & Snacks/Drinks Covered!
 
Before that, as per the Amherst College rules, please fill out the waiver below so that we can start the ball rolling! And, I have also sent all of you invites on the Hub to join the club, so please accept the invite there to stay posted! (GroupMe: https://groupme.com/join_group/97352198/c7Az2Nim)

How do I sign the waiver?

Link: https://risk-management.mtholyoke.edu/waivers/login.php

Once logged in, you should click on Waiver Form in the top left-hand corner, and then select the following from the drop-down menus:

College: Amherst College
Activity Type: Student Group
Activity Name: Amherst College Cricket Club

After that you will be prompted to sign and fill in your background information!

Thank you so much for your support and patience throughout this!

Take care,

Founder & President of Cricket Club

title: Shabbat Dinner
event_description: Please join us for Shabbat Dinner every Friday night in the Friedmann Room (second floor of Keefe Campus Center)! We provide a catered meal from a local restaurant, bakery challah, dessert, and some lovely Jewish conversation. Please contact hillel@amherst.edu or scolt@amherst.edu with questions.

title: Archery Practice @ Sattva Archery Range
event_description: Weekly archery practice at the Sattva range in Northampton. Connect with the club on our GroupMe if you are interested in joining!
location: Sattva Center for Archery Training, Northampton, MA

title: Popcorn Pop-in
event_description: Pop in to Student Engagement and Leadership every Wednesday for popcorn and conversation! A special topping every week, good company, and a time to ask questions about your organizations. We can't wait to see you!

title: 3D meeting!!!!!!!
event_description: 3D (Making a Difference for the Developmentally Disabled) Meeting!!

title: Mammoth MakerLab Weekly Meetings
event_description: Join us every Sunday at 8:00 p.m. in SCCE A113 to work on/develop a creative project using a 3D printer, laser cutter, resin printer, Arduino board, or soldering kit. No previous experience required!

title: Weekly Discretionary
event_description: Join the AAS Budgetary Committee (BC) to request funding from the AAS Discretionary Fund for any student activities you wish to put on! Prior to arriving, please review the funding policies and put your name, the club you are representing, and what you are asking for here under the appropriate week. Please forward any questions to budgetary@amherst.edu or reach out to your BC Representatives listed here.
location: Cole Assembly Room (Red Room), Converse Hall

title: Weekly Meeting
event_description: Our weekly AAS meeting where we pass Budgetary reccomendations and discuss issues on campus.

title: Fencing Club Practice
event_description:
The anatomy of a typical fencing club meeting is as follows:

1) Warmup: We might play a quick game involving running, or we may just jog for a minute or two

2) Stretching: Stretching is important before working out!

3) Footwork: Footwork is key to fencing! We practice it each meeting to make sure we've got it down, and play some footwork-based games

4) Bladework: We break out the swords and learn how to use them!

5) Fencing: We set up electric scoring equipment and fence each other with the remaining time

This semester, we are meeting Tuesdays and Thursdays at 4-5:30 in Middleton Gym!

For more information, contact mammothfencing@gmail.com!

title: Regular Theatrical Choreography Club (TCC) Meeting
event_description: Gather one and all to practice your sword (among other weapons) combat against friend and foe alike, SAFELY. To create great spectacles and drama is terrific on its own but what if you added WEAPONS (AND SAFETY). If the likes of the Princess Bride or Pirates of the Caribbean have ever gotten your blood rushing and riled up your instinct to pick up a roughly sword-shaped object, then this is the place for you to indulge those desires, SAFELY. So join us if you dare, but only if you are prepared for a fun (and safe) time...
location: Middleton Gym - Alumni Gym OR Front of Alumni Gym (Weather Depending)

title: Amherst Debate Society Practice
event_description: Practice with us

title: Queer and Questioning
event_description: Do you have questions about queerness? Are you exploring your identity? Are you in need of a space to discuss anything gender and/or sexuality related with no labels involved? Then stop by our student-led support group at Keefe 203, every Tuesday at 7:30 pm. All sessions are private and do not require regular involvement! No college staff/faculty will be present during the sessions.
